message.content:
cs.ET, cs.NE, cs.CV, cs.AR, cs.LG. 

The paper presents a memristive circuit design for implementing a variable pixel G-Neighbor filter for denoising images. This involves edge-aware adaptive filtering, which is a common technique in computer vision and image processing (cs.CV). The memristive circuits used in the design exhibit neuromorphic architectures, which is a topic of interest in the field of neural networks (cs.NE). The paper also evaluates the circuit design for various parameters such as processing time, fabrication area used, and power consumption, which falls under the category of electronic devices and circuits (cs.ET). The use of mean square error (MSE) and peak signal-to-noise ratio (PSNR) as image quality metrics is also common in image processing and computer vision (cs.AR). Finally, the paper combines adaptive filtering with mean filter, which is a technique commonly used in machine learning and data analysis (cs.LG).
